TestStory.name: CANCEL
TestStory.Description: Patient 5, with a diagnosis of chronic heart failure, is not feeling well. Although he takes his therapy regularly, last few days he has been swelling, feeling nausea, fatigue and shortness of breath. He makes an appointment with his cardiologist Provider 3 to check on his condition and treatment. Due to fluid retention Patient 5 is taking Lasix 40mg, one tablet a day. For preventing hypokalemia, patient is taking Klor-Con 10 mEq extended-release tablets, one tablet two times a day. On the appointment provider decides to run some blood tests. Results showed high levels of creatinine 2.3 mg/dL and potassium levels 5.0 mEq/L. This indicates that patient has kidney failure. For better assessment of patient’s kidney function, Provider 3 orders more testing. Meanwhile, he sends a cancel request for the remaining refills for Klor-con 10 mEq extended-release tablets to the patients’ Pharmacy 1. Pharmacy 1 sends a cancel response to Provider 3, informing him that 3 remaining refills for Klor-Con 10 mEq extended-release tablets were successfully canceled.
TestStory.Precondition: Vendor has pre-configured the test prescribers, pharmacies, and patients, and has used one of each in this test.
TestStory.Postcondition: SCRIPT 10.6 NEWRX and CANCEL prescription messages has been generated by the test system.
TestStory.TestObjectives: Confirm correct population of the SCRIPT 10.6 NEWRX prescription message. and Confirm correct population of the SCRIPT 10.6 CANCEL request message. and Confirm correct population of the SCRIPT 10.6 CANCEL response message.
TestStory.Notes: Visually compare /Message/Body/NewRx/MedicationPrescribed/DrugDescription to the RxNorm name and synonyms. and Visually compare /Message/Body/NewRx/MedicationPrescribed/Directions to the directions in the test description.
